intro: Bonatea saundersiae, commonly known as the St. Helena bellflower, is a rare flowering plant endemic to the island of St. Helena in the South Atlantic Ocean. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces striking blue to violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant has small, narrow leaves and is adapted to the unique microclimate of its native habitat. It is classified within the Campanulaceae family, which includes several other bellflowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Bonatea saundersiae is considered critically endangered.
